page.title: 05A DAY IN THE LIFE OF A VET
page.content: Wednesday 3rd. July 1985 The day began in a poulty processing factory where my job was to make sure that the meat produced was disease free and hygienically processed. After lunch I engaged in a small animal surgery. The phone rang at 4 p.m._an emergency and a trip out to an outlying farm to produce a calf out of a cow. The phone rang again while I was at the farm and I had to proceed to another farm where I had to treat a lame cow. I picked out a nail from her foot and injected her with anti_biotic to prevent further infection. At 5.30p.m. another pet surgery lasting until 6.30. I was "on call" for emergencies in the evening, fortunately only one, at 10 p.m. a whippet with a sore throat. A quick read of the "Vetinary Record" and off to bed.
